title: Stock Futures Slip With Major Earnings on Tap; Results are due from General Motors, Coca-Cola and McDonald's before the open; Alphabet and Microsoft will report after the close
text:
In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 fell 0.1% in morning trade as gains in materials and energy sectors were balanced by losses in consumer discretionary and financials sectors.

Kingfisher slipped 4.8% snapping a winning streak of more than a week and Ocado Group declined 2.3%.

The U.K.'s FTSE 100 added 0.3%. Other stock indexes in Europe also mostly slipped as France's CAC 40 was lower 0.4%, the U.K.'s FTSE 250 fell 0.3% and Germany's DAX shed 0.3%.

The British pound was down 0.1% against the U.S. dollar, with 1 pound buying $1.20 whereas the Swiss franc and the euro traded flat against the dollar.

In commodities, international benchmark Brent crude was up 1.9% to $102.11 a barrel. Gold also gained 0.3% to $1,724.90 a troy ounce.

German 10-year bund yields declined to 0.989% and the 10-year gilts yield was down to 1.915%. The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield slipped to 2.782% from 2.819%. Bond yields and prices move inversely.

Stocks in Asia were mixed as Hong Kong's Hang Seng gained 1.8% and China's benchmark Shanghai Composite climbed 0.8%, whereas Japan's Nikkei 225 index lost 0.2%.

Stock Futures Slip With Major Earnings on Tap
